What was Juan Soto's contract details?

**Juan Soto, Mets contract: $765 million, 15 years - MLB.com**
The Mets have signed Juan Soto to a 15-year, $765 M contract. It is the largest contract in Major League Baseball history. Soto is one of the best hitters in the game. The deal includes a full no-trade clause and an opt-out clause. The Mets will pay Soto $51 M per season. The contract is worth $765million.

---

Shortly after Soto agreed to terms, the NBA star Donovan Mitchell, a lifelong Mets fan by virtue of his father's employment with the team, \[posted a screenshot on X of a grinning Soto flashing a peace sign]\(https\://twitter. com/spidadmitchell/status/1865959522096783853) on a video call. Within minutes, thousands of likes and comments came streaming in.

No, the Mets are most certainly not a punchline anymore. Quite suddenly, they are a destination -- the perfect marriage of a brilliant player in his prime and a billionaire owner who simply refused to be denied.

Senior Reporter \[Anthony DiComo]\(mailto:Anthony. com) has covered the Mets for MLB.


**Juan Soto contract breakdown: Details of Mets' $765M deal, including ...**
Soto's contract is the largest in Major League Baseball history. Soto's deal includes an opt-out option after five years. The deal is worth $765 M. S. O. B. will receive a $52 M signing bonus. S O. B. 's contract is worth > $100 M. It is the biggest contract in Major Leaguer history.


**Juan Soto | MLB Contracts & Salaries | Spotrac.com**

**Juan Soto's record-breaking Mets contract: Terms, details, what to know**
The New York Mets have signed free agent Juan Soto to a 15-year, $765 M contract. Soto's contract is the largest in MLB history. The previous record was $700 M, set by Shohei Ohtani. Sato's contract doesn't include any deferred money. It's the largest contract for any athlete anywhere in the world.

---

Soto reportedly considered four other teams before agreeing to terms with the Mets: the New York Yankees, Los Angeles Dodgers, Boston Red Sox and Toronto Blue Jays. Only the terms of the Yankees' offer to Soto have leaked at this time. According to Jon Heyman of the *New York Post*, \[the Yankees offered Soto]\(https\://www. com/mlb/yankees-made-760-million-offer-juan-soto-before-signed-with-mets) $760 million over 16 years to stay in the Bronx. That wasn't enough to keep Soto from making the move across the East River to Queens.

Cohen and the Mets made a huge statement by landing Soto. / Brad Penner-Imagn Images.

**Juan Soto – New York Mets Contract (signed May 2024)** | Item | Details | |------|---------| | **Length** | 15‑year deal (2025 – 2039) | | **Total Value** | **$765 million** (largest contract in MLB history) | | **Average Annual Value (AAV)** | ≈ **$51 million per season** | | **Signing Bonus** | $52 million (paid up‑front) | | **Guaranteed Salary** | All $765 M is fully guaranteed – no deferred or performance‑based money reported. | | **Opt‑out Clause** | Player may opt out after **five seasons** (i.e., after the 2029 season). If he exercises the opt‑out, the remaining 10 years become a new contract that can be renegotiated or re‑signed. | | **No‑Trade Provision** | Full **no‑trade clause** – Soto cannot be traded without his consent. | | **Other Notable Provisions** | • No reported “player option” beyond the five‑year opt‑out.
• No salary arbitration rights (the contract supersedes any future arbitration eligibility).
• The Mets retain all rights to a possible extension or renegotiation after the opt‑out, but Soto would be free to test free agency at that point. | | **Context** | • At the time of signing, it surpassed Shohei Ohtani’s $700 M (16‑year) deal as the biggest MLB contract ever.
• The Mets reportedly offered a “home‑run‑friendly” schedule and a competitive roster to entice Soto away from other suitors (Yankees, Dodgers, Red Sox, Blue Jays).
• The offer was widely reported by MLB.com, Spotrac, and major news outlets. | ### Quick Takeaways - **Financially**: $765 M over 15 years = roughly $51 M per year, making Soto the highest‑paid player on an annual basis in baseball history. - **Flexibility for Soto**: The five‑year opt‑out gives him a chance to re‑enter free agency (or renegotiate) while still in his prime, preserving leverage if market values rise further. - **Team Control**: The full no‑trade clause locks the Mets into keeping Soto unless he agrees, providing roster stability for the franchise. If you need more granular breakdowns (year‑by‑year salary schedule, comparison with other recent mega‑deals, or implications for the Mets’ payroll and luxury‑tax calculations), just let me know!

**New York Knicks vs. Portland Trail Blazers Live Score and Stats ...**
The New York Knicks snapped the Portland Trail Blazers' five-game winning streak with a 123-114 victory Sunday. The extent of the injury was not known. The Knicks had lost five of their previous six games. The Blazers got back guard Jrue Holiday, who hasn't played since mid-November because of a calf injury. The game was a back-and-forth affair until the final minutes. The teams were tied at 92 in the third quarter, but the Knicks pulled away.

The **New York Knicks** (officially the *New York Knickerbockers*) are a professional men’s basketball team that competes in the National Basketball Association (NBA). Here’s a concise overview: | Category | Details | |----------|---------| | **Founded** | 1946 (originally part of the Basketball Association of America, which merged with the NBL to become the NBA) | | **Location** | Manhattan, New York City, New York State | | **Home Arena** | Madison Square Garden (often called “The Garden”) – located at 4 Pennsylvania Plaza, Midtown Manhattan | | **Team Colors** | Blue, orange, and white | | **Conference & Division** | Eastern Conference – Atlantic Division | | **Ownership** | Madison Square Garden Sports Corp. (controlled by James L. Dolan) | | **General Manager (as of 2026)** | Troy Weaver | | **Head Coach (as of 2026)** | Tom Thibodeau | | **Recent Performance** | The Knicks have been rebuilding under Thibodeau, emphasizing strong defense and a balanced offense. They returned to the playoffs in the 2022‑23 season after a several‑year drought and are aiming to become consistent contenders. | | **Key Players (2025‑26 roster highlights)** | • **Julius Randle** – Power forward, All‑Star, primary scorer
• **Jalen Brunson** – Point guard, floor general, strong playmaker
• **RJ Barrett** – Young wing with scoring upside
• **Micheal Carter‑Willis** – Defensive specialist at guard
• **Obi Toppin** – Athletic forward providing energy off the bench | | **Historical Highlights** | • NBA Champions: 1970, 1973 (the only two titles in franchise history)
• Hall of Famers: Willis Reed, Walt Furlong, Patrick Ewing, Charles Oakley, John Starks, and many others
• Iconic moments: “The Knicks‑Celtics rivalry” of the 1990s, the 1994 Eastern Conference Finals run | | **Fan Base & Culture** | • One of the NBA’s most passionate and media‑savvy fan bases, often referred to as “Knicks Nation.”
• Known for a strong New York identity—players frequently appear in city‑wide advertising and community events.
• The team’s mascot is **“Champ”**, a blue-furred dog that entertains fans during games. | | **Rivalries** | • Boston Celtics (historic East rivalry)
• Miami Heat (recent playoff battles)
• Brooklyn Nets (city‑wide “Battle of the Boroughs”) | ### Quick Takeaways - The Knicks are an iconic NBA franchise with a storied past, two championships, and a massive global following. - They play at Madison Square Garden in Manhattan, making every home game a high‑profile event. - Under current leadership, the team is focused on building a defensively tough, playoff‑ready roster centered around stars like Julius Randle and Jalen Brunson.

* **Insulation rating 600‑650 fill** (down or high‑quality synthetic) provides enough trapped air to keep you warm even when the wind is gusty.

With AMD’s FSR 3.0 upscaling, many AAA games reach playable frame rates even at 1440p. * **Synthetic Benchmarks:** Cinebench R23 scores around **7,800‑8,200** (single‑core) and **55k‑58k** (multi‑core), comparable to a laptop‑class Ryzen 7 6800U. * **Thermals & Noise:** In “Quiet” mode (35 W) the fan is barely audible (<30 dB). Under full load (“Performance” 54–70 W) noise rises to ~45 dB, which some reviewers find loud for a mini‑PC but still acceptable for most desks. * **Power Draw:** Typical idle ≈ 7 W; gaming/compute loads average 35‑55 W—much lower than a full‑size desktop. --- ## Pros & Cons (Summarized) | Pros | Cons | |------|------| | • Very compact, VESA‑mountable

• 32 GB DDR5 out of the box
• Dual 2.5 GbE NICs (great for networking)
• USB‑4 & OCuLink give high‑bandwidth expansion options | • Integrated GPU, not a substitute for a dedicated RTX/AMD card in demanding AAA titles at max settings
• Fan can become noisy under sustained heavy load

### Why These Work for NYC Winter
* **Insulation rating 600‑650 fill** (down or high‑quality synthetic) provides enough trapped air to keep you warm even when the wind is gusty.
* **Water‑resistant/DWR outer fabric** protects against sleet or light snow—common in early January.
* **Hood and adjustable cuffs** reduce heat loss from head and wrists, which are major sources of chill.

### Quick Buying Tips
1. **Check sizing charts** – many budget jackets run a bit small; consider ordering one size up if you plan to layer thick sweaters underneath.
2. **Look for “Amazon’s Choice” or high‑rating (4 ★+) reviews** – these indicate consistent quality and good return policies.
3. **Watch for coupons/Lightning Deals** – prices often dip 10–20 % during morning sales.

### Where to Purchase
- **Amazon.com** – search the exact model names above; use filters “Price: Low‑to‑High” and “4+ stars”.
- **Columbia Outlet (online)** – sometimes offers extra discounts on the Mighty Lite.
- **REI Co‑op website** – member pricing may bring it under $90.

### Can the GMKtec M7 Ultra Mini‑PC run **Ragnarok Online** (RO)?

| Requirement | RO’s typical needs | M7 Ultra specs | Verdict |
|-------------|-------------------|----------------|---------|
| **CPU** | Very low – any modern dual‑core will do. | AMD Ryzen 7 PRO 6850U (8 C/16 T, up to ~4.5 GHz) | ✅ Overkill |
| **GPU** | 2D/low‑poly 3‑D engine; even integrated graphics are fine. | Integrated Radeon 680M (12 CUs, ~2 GB VRAM). With RO’s modest shader load this GPU is more than enough. | ✅ More than sufficient |
| **RAM** | 1–2 GB minimum; 4 GB+ recommended for smooth multitasking. | 32 GB DDR5 (dual‑channel) – plenty of headroom. | ✅ |
| **Storage** | Game size ≈ 300 MB; fast SSD not required but improves load times. | 1 TB PCIe 3.0 NVMe SSD → instant launches, quick patching. | ✅ |
| **Network** | Low‑latency broadband (≥ 5 Mbps). | Dual 2.5 GbE NIC + Wi‑Fi 6E – excellent connectivity. | ✅ |

**Bottom line:** The M7 Ultra will run Ragnarok Online flawlessly, even with multiple windows/tabs open (e.g., Discord, web browsers). The hardware is far beyond what the game demands.

## Recommended Setup for RO on this Mini‑PC

1. **Operating System**
   - Use Windows 11 Pro (default) – simplest install.
   - If you prefer Linux, install Ubuntu 22.04 LTS and run the official RO client via Wine; performance will be identical because the bottleneck is not hardware.

2. **Graphics Settings (in‑game)**
   | Setting | Recommended Value |
   |---------|-------------------|
   | Resolution | Native monitor resolution (e.g., 1920×1080). The game runs at > 200 fps, so you can even push to 1440p if you like. |
   | Texture Quality | Medium‑High – the GPU has enough VRAM; higher textures won’t impact frame rate. |
   | Shadow / Lighting Effects | Low‑Medium (RO’s engine is simple; turning these off saves a tiny amount of power). |
   | Anti‑Aliasing | Off or 2× MSAA – not needed for a 2D‑heavy title. |
   | VSync | Off (you’ll get > 200 fps, so screen tearing isn’t an issue on most monitors; enable only if you notice it). |

3. **System Tweaks**
   - **Power Profile:** Set Windows Power Options to “High performance” or the built‑in “Performance” mode in the BIOS/UEFI (65 W) for maximum CPU boost when you’re playing.
   - **Background Apps:** Close heavy background programs (e.g., video editors, large downloads) to keep CPU temps low; not required but helps maintain a quiet fan curve.
   - **Driver Updates:** Install the latest AMD Radeon drivers (AMD Adrenalin 2026 edition) and Intel I226‑V NIC driver for best network stability.

4. **Networking**
   - Use the wired 2.5 GbE port if possible; it guarantees the lowest latency and eliminates Wi‑Fi interference.
   - If you must use Wi‑Fi, enable “Wi‑Fi 6E” mode in Windows Network Settings for the best throughput.

5. **Audio & Peripherals**
   - The built‑in 3.5 mm combo jack works fine with a headset or speakers.
   - For voice chat (Discord/TeamSpeak) you can use any USB headset; the PC’s USB‑4 ports provide ample bandwidth.

---

## Expected Performance Numbers (based on community benchmarks)

| Metric | Approximate Value |
|--------|-------------------|

| **CPU Utilization (idle)** | ~5 % |
| **CPU Utilization (in‑game)** | 10 % – 15 % (still low, leaving headroom for other apps) |
| **GPU Utilization** | < 20 % (Radeon 680M is barely taxed) |
| **Power Draw while playing** | ~30 W – 40 W (quiet operation) |
| **Temperature (CPU)** | 55 °C – 65 °C under load (well within safe limits) |

---

## Verdict & Recommendation

- **Performance:** More than adequate; you’ll never hit a bottleneck.
- **Thermals/Noise:** The fan will stay relatively quiet because the workload is light. If you notice occasional spikes, set the BIOS to “Quiet” mode (35 W) – RO will still run at > 150 fps.
- **Value:** You’re paying for high‑end specs that far exceed what an MMORPG like Ragnarok Online needs, but you gain future‑proofing for any other games or tasks you might want later.

**Recommendation:** Go ahead and purchase the GMKtec M7 Ultra. Install Windows 11 (or your preferred Linux distro), apply the settings above, and you’ll have a buttery‑smooth RO experience with plenty of headroom for streaming, Discord, or running additional applications simultaneously. It's a been a while since I have played Ragnarok. But I have years of experience of playing the game in the teen years. I am currently 38. Here is my plan for succeeding in the game after not playing for or years   . I think I create a character class that is fairly easy to level with low level gear and capable of sf solo leveling low level du dungeons early on. and using that class to funnel my way to my favorite class of Monk. But since Monks are gear dependent and leveling an acolyte is a hard thing to do it make makes sense to start with an easire class. what are your thoughts?

### Quick‑Start Roadmap for a Returning Player *(Goal: Reach **Monk** as fast and pain‑free as possible while still having fun on the way)* | Phase | Recommended “bridge” class | Why it’s good for early solo play | How you transition to Monk | |-------|----------------------------|----------------------------------|-----------------------------| | **1️⃣ 0–30 Base Level** | **Thief (or Assassin later)** – start as a **Novice → Thief** | • High base ATK, fast attack speed → kills mobs quickly.
• Low‑level gear is cheap and easy to find (daggers, leather armor).
• No reliance on expensive weapons or cards; you can farm “Thief’s Belt” or “Boots of Speed” from early dungeons (Payon Cave 1–2) for a nice DPS boost.
• You already have the **Steal** skill, which is handy for grabbing useful items (e.g., *Memento* cards). | When you hit **Base Level 30**, quit the Thief job and **re‑class to Acolyte** (you’ll need a **2nd Job Change NPC** in Prontera). | | **2️⃣ 30–50 Base Level** | **Acolyte → Priest** (still using the same character) | • The Acolyte job gives you **Heal**, **Increase AGI/INT**, and **Blessing** – essential for survivability while you finish the “low‑level dungeons” that Thief struggled with (e.g., *Moc Fob* or *Geffen Dungeon 1*).
• Priest’s **Sanctuary** and **Magnus Exorcismus** give you AoE damage and crowd control, making solo runs smoother.
• Gear is still cheap: a **Holy Stick**, **Robe of Castor**, and the classic **Memento Card** (from *Poring* or *Thief* drops) are enough to keep you alive. | At **Base Level 50**, do the **2nd Job Change** for Acolyte → **Priest** (Prontera). | | **3️⃣ 50–70 Base Level** | **Priest → Monk (Transcendent)** | • Once you reach **Base Level 70**, you can finally **transcend to Monk** via the *Monk Transcendent* quest (you’ll need a **2nd Job Change NPC** in *Geffen* and a **Monk Card** from the “*Marduk*” monster or a *Kafra* item).
• The Monk’s core skills (**Combo Finish**, **Bowling Bash**, **Spear Mastery**) become usable at **Job Level 1** (which you get right after transcending).
• Because you already have decent gear from the Priest phase (e.g., *Memento* + *Valkyrie’s Shield*, *Holy Stick* upgraded to *Arc Wand*), you won’t be “gear‑starved”. | **Transcend**: Talk to the *Monk Transcendent NPC* in Geffen, complete the short quest (collect a *Red Gemstone* and a *Blue Gemstone* from the *Marduk* area). After that you’ll be a **Monk (Transcendent)**. | | **4️⃣ 70 Base Level → Endgame** | **Monk (Transcendent) – continue leveling** | • From here on, focus on **high‑damage combos**, **Spear Mastery**, and **Buff/Heal** from your previous Priest skills (you keep them!).
• Gear priority: *Two‑handed Spear* with **+ATK** cards (*Hydra*, *Megalodon*), *Valkyrie’s Shield* or *Rogue’s Shield* for +DEF, and *Memento* on armor.
• Join a guild or party for the **Bifrost/Thanatos** dungeons – Monk shines in AoE damage. | Keep grinding until you hit **Base Level 99**, then move to **Job Level 70** (Monk’s 2nd‑job skill *Grand Cross*). | --- ## Why This Path Beats “Start Directly as Acolyte → Priest → Monk” | Issue | Starting as Acolyte directly | Bridge‑class solution | |-------|------------------------------|------------------------| | **Low DPS at early levels** (0–30) | Acolytes have low attack, rely on *Heal* and *Blessing*, making solo grinding slow. | Thief’s high base ATK + *Steal* lets you clear *Payon Cave 1‑2* quickly, gaining EXP and useful loot without needing expensive gear. | | **Gear dependency** | Acolytes need early *Holy Stick* or *Mace* to be viable; those items are rarer than a simple dagger. | Thief can use any low‑level weapon (dagger, sword) and still be effective; you’ll acquire better gear later when you already have gold from fast farming. | | **Skill overlap** | You lose the chance to keep *Steal* (useful for getting rare cards). | By keeping the same character, you retain all Thief skills (including *Steal*) even after changing jobs – they become “passive” but still usable when you’re a Priest/Monk. | | **Transition time** | You’d need to hit 30 Base Level as Acolyte before you can change to Priest, which takes longer because of slower kill speed. | Hitting 30 Base Level as Thief is usually **2‑3 hours** for a returning player; the same level as Acolyte could take **4‑5 hours**. | --- ## Practical Tips & “Cheat‑Sheet” for Each Phase ### Phase 1 – Thief (0‑30) - **Skill build:** Max *Double Attack* at 10, then *Steal* (max), *Hiding*, *Envenom*. - **Gear hunt:** - **Weapon:** *Dagger* + *Memento Card* → ~+150 ATK.
‑ If you find a *Sharp Blade* or *Kukre’s Knife* early, swap it in. - **Armor:** *Leather Armor* (or *Robe of Castor*) + *Memento*. - **Accessory:** *Thief’s Belt* (+5% ATK) from Payon Cave 2. - **EXP spots:** *Payon Cave 1‑2*, *Poring* farms in Prontera fields, *Mummy* (Geffen). ### Phase 2 – Acolyte → Priest (30‑50) - **Skill build:** Take *Heal* (max), *Increase AGI/INT*, *Blessing*. Keep *Sanctuary* for AoE. - **Gear upgrades:** - **Weapon:** *Holy Stick* → upgrade to *Arc Wand* when you have enough Zeny (≈ 30 k). - **Shield:** *Valkyrie’s Shield* (+DEF, +HP) from *Moc Fob* or buy cheap. - **Armor:** Keep the *Memento*‑infused set; add a *Red Gemstone* card for extra HP if you can. - **EXP spots:** *Geffen Dungeon 1‑2*, *Moc Fob* (good for both EXP and gear). ### Phase 3 – Monk Transcendent (70+) - **Skill build (first 10 job levels):** - **Combo Finish** (max), **Bowling Bash**, **Spear Mastery** (max). - Keep *Heal* and *Blessing* from Priest – they’re still usable. - **Gear priority:** - **Weapon:** *Two‑handed Spear* with +ATK cards (*Hydra*, *Megalodon*) → aim for ~+300 ATK total. - **Shield/Armor:** *Valkyrie’s Shield* + *Memento* armor set (or *Robe of Castor* if you prefer lighter gear). - **Accessory:** *Ring of the Sun* (+HP) or *Orcish Gloves* (+ATK). - **Dungeons to farm for gear/EXP:** *Bifrost*, *Thanatos*, *Marduk* (for the Monk Card), and later *Goddess’s* dungeons. --- ## Optional “Shortcut” – Use a **Second Character** for Gear Farming If you have extra Zeny or want to keep your main clean, create a **second low‑level character** (any class) just to farm cheap gear: 1. **Farm Payon Cave 2** → get *Thief’s Belt* and *Memento Card*. 2. **Sell excess items** for Zeny; use the money on your main’s *Arc Wand* and *Spear* upgrades. Because you’re already an experienced player, this extra step usually only adds a few hours of “grind” but can save you from hunting expensive cards later. --- ## TL;DR – One‑Sentence Plan **Start as Thief (fast solo DPS), hit Base 30 → switch to Acolyte/​Priest for survivability and cheap gear, then at Base 70 transcend to Monk. Keep all previous skills, upgrade to a two‑handed spear + Memento set, and you’ll be grinding high‑damage combos in dungeons within ~2–3 weeks of playtime.** Enjoy your return to Rune‑Midgard!
